case.name: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v Global Prepaid Communications Pty Ltd (ACN 095 154 108) (inliquidation) (No 2) [2006] FCA 157 (27 February 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: recruiting distributors for a vending machine business and a swisscom sim cards business
including misleading representations as to future matters
extension of the act to individuals
orders to compensate third parties suffering loss
action for damages to be commenced within three years after cause of action accrued
accrual of cause of action to indemnifier
trade practices act 1974(cth), s. 82. federal court
barred cause of action introduced by amendment
whether permitted by rules of court
federal court of australia act 1976(cth), s. 86
whether costs ordered to be payable by certain respondents to be assessed as gross sum
where intervening bankruptcy in respect of certain respondents

citances.sentence: 1 This is an application pursuant to O 62 r 4(2)(c) of the Federal Court Rules that certain costs ordered to be payable by the respondents in this matter be assessed as a gross sum. The orders were made on 27 February 2006 ( Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v Global Prepaid Communications Pty Ltd (in liq) [2006] ATPR 42-103 , [2006] FCA 146 ; Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v Global Prepaid Communications Pty Ltd (in liq) (No 2) [2006] ATPR 42-104 , [2006] FCA 157). Order 42 provided that the third, fourth, fifth, sixth and seventh respondents pay the applicant's costs of the proceedings including all reserved costs, except those costs provided by order 43. Order 43 provided that the third and fourth respondents pay the applicant's costs of the hearing on 10, 25 and 26 May 2005.
